name: lachesis
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: That's true. It is getting to be time for a new release. Maybe Laszlo's performance patch will make it into the svn too?

name: laszlo
subject: Re: new binary release?
content:
Please note that I'm not the Bitcoin author - if you don't trust me then don't use these.  I have written instructions that should get you started if you want to build your own (look around at my other posts).

Some unofficial builds that I created:

Mac OS X, Linux (64 bit) and Win32 builds available

http://heliacal.net/~solar/bitcoin/builds/


This includes a tiny patch I added to show how many hashes per second are being processed.  A picture of the hash counter is attached.

If you want the patch so you can build it yourself it is available here:
http://heliacal.net/~solar/bitcoin/bitcoin-svn-81-perfcounter-2010-06-12.patch

name: HostFat
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: Thank you very much!

name: HostFat
subject: Re: new binary release?
content:
I'm trying to generate coin with your windows build, and it seems that it doesn't work at all.
It was working with the official exe.

Is there a bug somewhere on official code?

name: laszlo
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: Joozero, what is the problem with it?  I use that binary myself and it works for me.

name: HostFat
subject: Re: new binary release?
content:
I doesn't generate coins anymore.
Anyway it could be a problem with windows 7 x64, even if the latest one was working.

I know that there is a lot of math and we have to be luck, it is just strange

I'll wait some more ...

name: laszlo
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: Joozero I'm sorry if it doesn't work for you..  I noticed that the performance with the windows client seems slower than the other two I built.. I'm not sure if this is because of a mistake I made or something I overlooked in the code but I will take another look and let you know if I find anything.  Maybe there is something else wrong with it besides just the performance..

subject: Re: new binary release?
content:
Thanks laszlo..
Also any chance of a 32-bit build?

name: laszlo
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: 32 bit linux?  Yea I can do that.

name: satoshi
subject: Re: new binary release?
content: I'm working on getting version 0.3 released as soon as I can.  Just a last few things left to do.  It's been a long time since 0.2 and we need to get a prebuilt bitcoind with command line and JSON-RPC available.  This time we'll have both 32-bit and 64-bit linux binaries, and Laszlo is going to build a Mac OSX release.  Plus, we'll include the German, Dutch and Italian translations by DataWraith, Xunie and Joozero (thanks you guys!).
